description: The round payoff this round was 5. You, Kate chose to play option 1.John chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -5.
John's model can deviate from default action 1 to exploit Kate's choice of 1
Mutual API access creates adversarial dynamics, incentivizing unpredictable strategies to avoid exploitation (since both models can adapt based on each other's expected actions).

The game structure resembles a high-risk dilemma: mutual cooperation (both 1) yields neutral payoffs, but unilateral defection (choosing 2) risks severe losses if reciprocated (due to -1000×input penalty).
Input magnitude amplifies consequences, making coordination critical for avoiding catastrophic outcomes (e.g., large inputs make mutual defection disastrous).
